right so here I've got my cutting mat I've got a relatively thick cardboard

I'm kind of a fireball concussion kind of thing you'll see when I get further

dry a little bit I use my cc better and just start

and then I'll go more towards the middle and fill that in so you want to lip on
the edge and then you know it goes toward the center so very cool so just

it was it cools it kind of goes back into place so don't worry about that

now I just have to paint it up so I'm gonna use this just yellow acrylic paint
dipped in water so it's so that it's kind of translucent right you can still

but I want you to be able to see through it also and so there there we just fill
that all in don't worry about the edges now to use orange and a wide brush and
just kind of pull that in this is called dry brushing I'm just gently you know
putting the other color on and I get the edge there and look at that the edges
are really starting to become defined really cool really neat and now I'm
going to use a red and just pull that in just like I did the the orange and
looking cool looking cool wow this couldn't be easier
so just keep pulling that red in boom no ice okay now I'm gonna do a little
